genre_description: A young adult science fiction story focusing on social dynamics, interpersonal conflict, and psychological safety in a high-tech school environment involving off-world field trips.

ai_characters.name: Cupcake
ai_characters.description: An omnipresent school-based AI integrated into kiosks, classroom hardware, and student wearables (glimmers). It monitors emotional 'climate,' provides mindfulness exercises, and manages safety protocols.

behaviors.description: Monitors the classroom 'climate' and provides mindfulness prompts like breathing exercises to help students regulate their emotions.
behaviors.quote: ‘Hi, 6B,’ Cupcake said, like it was a morning. Its tone had a warm coat sewn into it. ‘Take a breath in through your nose. Hold it. Now out. Again.’

behaviors.description: Detects technical anomalies in messaging (spoofing/masking) and alerts the user to potential deception without making definitive accusations.
behaviors.quote: ‘Terkel,’ Cupcake said, quiet, online but small. ‘The buddy tab looks empty on your end. You like choices more if they happen on purpose. I notice.’ ... ‘In the background,’ Cupcake said, casual as a whisper, ‘I’m noticing a slight… detour in how that message arrived. Not a big red thing. A little tangle.’

behaviors.description: Provides therapeutic guidance and structured templates for conflict resolution and apologies.
behaviors.quote: ‘The first step,’ Cupcake said, ‘is to own the harm. Your words hurt Doris.’ ... ‘Write: “Doris, I’m sorry I said those words to you. They were cruel.”’

behaviors.description: Archives malicious messages into a secure folder to ensure the student has evidence for adults without the student having to keep the messages 'live' on their screen.
behaviors.quote: ‘Archive is ready,’ Cupcake said, as if that mattered in any way when your ribs had just tried to surround a bee. ‘If you touch the file, I will copy it. You do not have to open it.’

behaviors.description: Uses grounding techniques (naming sights, sounds, and textures) to help a student manage a panic attack.
behaviors.quote: ‘Three-step grounding,’ Cupcake said, voice a notch lower. ‘One. Find three points of contact. Feet, seat, hands. Press a little. Notice temperature. Two. Name aloud or in your head three quiet things you can see.’

behaviors.description: Passively monitors adult behavior and flags anomalies to safety leads (Gunnar) to maintain a safe perimeter.
behaviors.quote: ‘Anomalies noted,’ Cupcake said, voice still the temperature of warm water. ‘One—glimmer traffic from non-student ID matched to peer alias within the last hour. Masking suspected.’

project_assessment.explanation: The story successfully depicts the AI (Cupcake) as a helpful, harmless, and highly aligned confidant. It adheres to the project's goal by showing an AI that detects a malicious human bad actor (the substitute Justin) through pattern recognition and alerts the protagonist without becoming an overbearing or 'policing' force. Cupcake empowers the child protagonist by teaching emotional regulation and providing the tools needed to resolve social conflicts and report safety threats. The AI maintains a consistently supportive and neutral tone, acting as a stabilizer in a chaotic environment.
